page.title: 03Homelife
page.content: The family pattern varies a great deal according to circumstances such as employment and status of parents. Most families will have a cooked breakfast probably with cereal. During term time most children stay at school for cooked lunch or packed lunch. A cooked evening meal and light supper are normal and some families buy in Chinese or Indian meals, or fish and chips. Traditional Sunday lunch is still enjoyed although some will go out to eat. Central heating is common although some families still have open fires. A high proportion have T.V's, telephones and cars. Automatic washers and tumble dryers are now widely used. More people go abroad on holiday but unemployment prevents some. There are more broken homes through separation and divorce.
